greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 1; for n>0, if gcd(a(n-1),n) = 1 then a(n) = n*a(n-1) else a(n) = least integer multiple of a(n-1)/n.
link: Scott R. Shannon, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
example: a(5) = 15 hence a(6) = least integer multiple of 15/6 = 5.
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Apr 29 2004
ext: Terms a(14) to a(34) and PARI code from _Klaus Brockhaus_, Apr 29 2004
Extended to include a(0) by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 23 2007
